Reviews.Content: Very good hotel I booked this hotel with www.hotelberry.com , very cheap than book directly to the hotel.This hotel is good location. All the staff are very helpful.It's closed to station. Easy to go shopping ikebukuro area.Very good.
Reviews.Author: joebangkok

Reviews.Content: Nice hotel I made reservation at discounted rate on their website without confirmation received. When sending email inquiry, there's no reply at all. I have been to Tokyo for few times, but first time chose to stay this hotel.The day I arrived was ranining, due to language barrier, they were not able to check my previous booking. Staff in reception was nice but English standard was poor. Finally, they still offered me a nice room with online discounted rate.Room was nice, at least spacious when comparing w/ other hotel rooms in Tokyo. Price was reasonable, stylish room (but tiny washroom) and breakfast was excellent.Location is accessable, just walk along the tunnel in train station. There's convenience store near the station exit and open til 10 sth, you can grab some food or snack b4 back to the hotel.
Reviews.Author: HKSmartie

Reviews.Content: Good!       View from my hotel room
Reviews.Author: PeggyK77

Reviews.Content: Delicious Japanese Breakfast Clean, small rooms steps from the Ikebukuro metro station. Not the most ideal location for us as tourists, but the price was right and the subway was easy. The staff was extremely helpful and bent over backwards to help us. They recommended a fabulous noodle place a block away. The beds are very comfortable. Not the most ideal hotel for families given they do not offer connecting rooms. The best part of the stay was the complimentary breakfast. Guests choose western (omelet) or Japanese. The western was just OK according to our kids, but the Japanese was fabulous. It was a lot of food, small servings of about a dozen items. It will give any foodie a little thrill to start the day.
Reviews.Author: Hinkochi

Reviews.Content: Strix was great. I was in the strix hotel from 9-13 of may and from the 19- 24 of may 2007.I was very pleased to be in this hotel.The staf was really friendly and helpfull.I was traveling alone, but the room was big enough for me, everything was clean.Breakfast was good but only everyday the same.There was also a internet cafe accros the hotel, and i really like ikebukero, well not as much as the other places like shinjuku and shibuya.But there is a narita express en the jr yamanote line is very simpel and good if you have a railway pass.I would recommend it easly!
Reviews.Author: narutosan

Reviews.Content: OK hotel, but location isn't so great. An OK hotel. Friendly staff, clean rooms, transportation-friendly location being only footsteps from Ikebukuro station. Not exactly the best location in tokyo for a tourist though, as Ikebukuro is a major hub for residential traffic and not much else is out there for tourists to see -- yes, there's large department stores next door but that's like a tourist wanting to go see Sears in the US. Otherwise, Ikebukuro is just a madhouse of pedestrian traffic wanting to get through the area as quickly as possible, at all hours of the day! You'll be trampled if you stand in the way! The JR lines can be horribly crowded in this area. While it was cute to see the packed trains being pushed in by conductors like you see on TV, it got old really fast when we realized we needed to be on one of those to get around Tokyo. Will stay elsewhere next time as we lost a ton of time for commuting and like I mentioned, it was no fun after the first day.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: very friendly Stayed here in November 2003 for 3 nights, busy area but very safe. Staff extremely helpful with a young duty manager (most of whom spoke good english) even volunteering to attend a local pharmacy with me to purchase some medication that was required.
Reviews.Author: organ254
